networking.enterprise.mesh.gloo.solo.io..description:
A `VirtualHost` is used to configure routes. It is selected by a `VirtualGateway`, and may be attached
   to more than one gateway. The `VirtualHost` contains the top-level configuration and route options, such
   as domains to match against, and any options to be shared by its routes. Routes can send traffic directly
   to a service, or can delegate to a `RouteTable` to perform further routing decisions.

domains.description:
The list of domains (i.e.: matching the `Host` header of a request) that belong to this virtual host.
Note that the wildcard will not match the empty string. e.g. “*-bar.foo.com” will match “baz-bar.foo.com”
but not “-bar.foo.com”. Additionally, a special entry “*” is allowed which will match any host/authority header.
Only a single virtual host on a gateway can match on “*”. A domain must be unique across all
virtual hosts on a gateway or the config will be invalidated by Gloo
Domains on virtual hosts obey the same rules as [Envoy Virtual Hosts](https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/blob/master/api/envoy/api/v2/route/route.proto)

options.description:
Route table options contain additional configuration to be applied to all traffic served by the route table.
Some configuration here can be overridden by Route Options.
OutlierDetection and TrafficShift isn't supported on the route level.

corsPolicy.description:
Set a Cross-Origin Resource Sharing policy (CORS) for requests. Refer to [this link](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Access_control_CORS)
for further details about cross origin resource sharing.

allowCredentials.description:
Indicates whether the caller is allowed to send the actual request
(not the preflight) using credentials. Translates to the
`Access-Control-Allow-Credentials` header.

allowHeaders.description:
List of HTTP headers that can be used when requesting the
resource. Serialized to the `Access-Control-Allow-Headers` header.

allowMethods.description:
List of HTTP methods allowed to access the resource. The content will
be serialized to the `Access-Control-Allow-Methods` header.

allowOrigins.description: String patterns that match allowed origins. An origin is allowed if any of the string matchers match.

ignoreCase.description: If true, indicates the exact/prefix/suffix matching should be case insensitive. This has no effect for the regex match.

exposeHeaders.description:
A list of HTTP headers that browsers are allowed to
access. Serialized to the `Access-Control-Expose-Headers` header.

maxAge.description:
Specify how long the results of a preflight request can be
cached. Serialized to the `Access-Control-Max-Age` header.

csrf.description: Configure the Envoy based CSRF filter

additionalOrigins.description:
Specifies additional source origins that will be allowed in addition to
the destination origin.

ignoreCase.description: If true, indicates the exact/prefix/suffix matching should be case insensitive. This has no effect for the regex match.

filterEnabled.description: Specifies that CSRF policies will be evaluated, tracked and enforced.

percentage.description:
Specifies the % of requests for which the CSRF filter is enabled or when shadow mode is enabled the % of requests
evaluated and tracked, but not enforced.

If filter_enabled or shadow_enabled is true.
Envoy will lookup the runtime key to get the percentage of requests to filter.

.. note:: This field defaults to 100

shadowEnabled.description:
Specifies that CSRF policies will be evaluated and tracked, but not enforced.

This is intended to be used when ``filter_enabled`` is false and will be ignored otherwise.

abort.description: Abort the request and return the specified error code back to traffic source.

httpStatus.description: Required. HTTP status code to use to abort the request.

fixedDelay.description: Add a delay of a fixed duration before sending the request. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. MUST be >=1ms.

percentage.description: Percentage of requests to be faulted. Values range between 0 and 100. If omitted all requests will be faulted.

appendRequestHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before forwarding a request to the destination service.

appendResponseHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before returning a response to the caller.

removeRequestHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before forwarding a request to the destination service.

removeResponseHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before returning a response to the caller.

mirror.description: Mirror traffic to a another destination (traffic will be sent to its original destination in addition to the mirrored destinations).

kubeService.description: Reference (name, namespace, Gloo Mesh cluster) to a Kubernetes service.

clusterName.description: name of the cluster in which the resource exists

name.description: name of the resource being referenced

namespace.description: namespace of the resource being referenced

percentage.description: Percentage of traffic to mirror. If omitted all traffic will be mirrored. Values must be between 0 and 100.

port.description: Port on the destination to receive traffic. Required if the destination exposes multiple ports.

mtls.description: Configure mTLS settings. If specified will override global default defined in Settings.

outlierDetection.description:
Configure [outlier detection](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/intro/arch_overview/upstream/outlier) on the selected destinations.
Specifying this field requires an empty `source_selector` because it must apply to all traffic.

baseEjectionTime.description: The minimum ejection duration. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. Must be >= `1ms`. A default will be used if not set.

consecutiveErrors.description: The number of errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool. A default will be used if not set.

interval.description: The time interval between ejection sweep analysis. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. Must be >= `1ms`. A default will be used if not set.

maxEjectionPercent.description:
The maximum percentage of hosts that can be ejected from the load balancing pool.
At least one host will be ejected regardless of the value. Must be between 0 and 100. A default will be used if not set.

rateLimit.description: Config the Envoy based Ratelimit filter

advanced.description:
Partial config for GlooE rate-limiting based on Envoy's rate-limit service;
supports Envoy's rate-limit service API. (reference here: https://github.com/lyft/ratelimit#configuration)
Configure rate-limit *actions* here, which define how request characteristics get translated into
descriptors used by the rate-limit service for rate-limiting. Configure rate-limit *descriptors* and
their associated limits on the Gloo settings.
Only one of `ratelimit` or `rate_limit_configs` can be set.

actions.description:
Define individual rate limits here. Each rate limit will be evaluated, if any rate limit
would be throttled, the entire request returns a 429 (gets throttled)
TODO: come up with descriptive names and comments for these fields

genericKey.description: Rate limit on a generic key.

descriptorValue.description: The value to use in the descriptor entry.

headerValueMatch.description: Rate limit on the existence of request headers.

descriptorValue.description: The value to use in the descriptor entry.

expectMatch.description:
If set to true, the action will append a descriptor entry when the
request matches the headers. If set to false, the action will append a
descriptor entry when the request does not match the headers. The
default value is true.

headers.description:
Specifies a set of headers that the rate limit action should match
on. The action will check the request’s headers against all the
specified headers in the config. A match will happen if all the
headers in the config are present in the request with the same values
(or based on presence if the value field is not in the config).

exactMatch.description: If specified, header match will be performed based on the value of the header.

invertMatch.description:
If specified, the match result will be inverted before checking. Defaults to false.

Examples:

* The regex *\d{3}* does not match the value *1234*, so it will match when inverted.
* The range [-10,0) will match the value -1, so it will not match when inverted.

name.description: Specifies the name of the header in the request.

prefixMatch.description:
If specified, header match will be performed based on the prefix of the header value.
Note: empty prefix is not allowed, please use present_match instead.

Examples:

* The prefix *abcd* matches the value *abcdxyz*, but not for *abcxyz*.

presentMatch.description:
If specified, header match will be performed based on whether the header is in the
request.

rangeMatch.description:
If specified, header match will be performed based on range.
The rule will match if the request header value is within this range.
The entire request header value must represent an integer in base 10 notation: consisting of
an optional plus or minus sign followed by a sequence of digits. The rule will not match if
the header value does not represent an integer. Match will fail for empty values, floating
point numbers or if only a subsequence of the header value is an integer.

Examples:

* For range [-10,0), route will match for header value -1, but not for 0, "somestring", 10.9,
  "-1somestring"

regexMatch.description:
If specified, this regex string is a regular expression rule which implies the entire request
header value must match the regex. The rule will not match if only a subsequence of the
request header value matches the regex. The regex grammar used in the value field is defined
`(here)[https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/regex/ecmascript]`.

Examples:

* The regex *\d{3}* matches the value *123*
* The regex *\d{3}* does not match the value *1234*
* The regex *\d{3}* does not match the value *123.456*

suffixMatch.description:
If specified, header match will be performed based on the suffix of the header value.
Note: empty suffix is not allowed, please use present_match instead.

Examples:

* The suffix *abcd* matches the value *xyzabcd*, but not for *xyzbcd*.

descriptorKey.description: The key to use in the descriptor entry.

headerName.description:
The header name to be queried from the request headers. The header’s
value is used to populate the value of the descriptor entry for the
descriptor_key.

genericKey.description: Rate limit on a generic key.

descriptorValue.description: The value to use in the descriptor entry.

headerValueMatch.description: Rate limit on the existence of request headers.

descriptorValue.description: The value to use in the descriptor entry.

expectMatch.description:
If set to true, the action will append a descriptor entry when the
request matches the headers. If set to false, the action will append a
descriptor entry when the request does not match the headers. The
default value is true.

headers.description:
Specifies a set of headers that the rate limit action should match
on. The action will check the request’s headers against all the
specified headers in the config. A match will happen if all the
headers in the config are present in the request with the same values
(or based on presence if the value field is not in the config).

Note: empty suffix is not allowed, please use present_match instead.

Examples:

descriptorKey.description: The key to use in the descriptor entry.

headerName.description:
The header name to be queried from the request headers. The header’s
value is used to populate the value of the descriptor entry for the
descriptor_key.

basic.description: Config for rate-limiting using simplified (gloo-specific) API

configRefs.description:
References to RateLimitConfig resources. This is used to configure the GlooE rate limit server.
Only one of `ratelimit` or `rate_limit_configs` can be set.

name.description: name of the resource being referenced

namespace.description: namespace of the resource being referenced

retries.description: Set a retry policy on requests.

attempts.description: Number of retries for a given request

perTryTimeout.description: Timeout per retry attempt for a given request. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. *Must be >= 1ms*.

trafficShift.description: Shift traffic to a different destination.

clusterHeader.description:
Envoy will determine the cluster to route to by reading the value of the HTTP header named by cluster_header from the request headers.
If the header is not found or the referenced cluster does not exist, Envoy will return a 404 response.
Avoid using this whenever possible, it does not allow for custom filter configuration based on Virtual Host.
{{/* NOTE: unimplemented */}}

clusterName.description: The Gloo Mesh cluster name (registration name) of the service.

port.description: Port on the service to receive traffic. Required if the service exposes more than one port.

subset.description: Specify, by labels, a subset of service instances to route to.

options.description:
additional options / config for a route which will be applied
when this destination is selected.

headerManipulation.description: manipualte headers on traffic sent to this destination

appendRequestHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before forwarding a request to the destination service.

appendResponseHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before returning a response to the caller.

removeRequestHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before forwarding a request to the destination service.

removeResponseHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before returning a response to the caller.

staticDestination.description: Reference to a gloo mesh Static Destination

name.description: name of the resource being referenced

namespace.description: namespace of the resource being referenced

name.description: The name of the VirtualDestination object.

namespace.description: The namespace of the VirtualDestination object.

subset.description: Specify, by labels, a subset of service instances backing the VirtualDestination to route to.

weight.description:
Specify the proportion of traffic to be forwarded to this destination.
Weights across all of the `destinations` must sum to 100.

routes.description:
The list of HTTP routes define routing actions to be taken for incoming HTTP requests whose host header matches
this virtual host. If the request matches more than one route in the list, the first route matched will be selected.
If the list of routes is empty, the virtual host will be ignored by Gloo.

delegateAction.description: Delegate routing actions for the given matcher to one or more RouteTables.

refs.description: Delegate to the RouteTable resources with matching `name` and `namespace`.

name.description: name of the resource being referenced

namespace.description: namespace of the resource being referenced

selector.description: Delegate to the RouteTables that match the given selector.

expressions.description:
Expressions allow for more flexible object label matching, such as equality-based requirements, set-based requirements, or a combination of both.
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#equality-based-requirement

key.description:
Kubernetes label key, must conform to Kubernetes syntax requirements
https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#syntax-and-character-set

operator.description: The operator can only be in, notin, =, ==, !=, exists, ! (DoesNotExist), gt (GreaterThan), lt (LessThan).

labels.description: Select objects whose labels match the ones specified here.

namespaces.description:
Select Objects in these namespaces. If omitted, Gloo Mesh will only select Objects in the same namespace
as the parent resource (e.g. VirtualGateway) that owns this selector.
The reserved value "*" can be used to select objects in all namespaces watched by Gloo Mesh.

directResponseAction.description: Return an arbitrary HTTP response directly, without proxying.

body.description:
Specifies the content of the response body. If this setting is omitted,
no body is included in the generated response.

Note: Headers can be specified using the Header Modification feature in the enclosing
Route, ConnectionHandler, or Gateway options.

status.description: Specifies the HTTP response status to be returned.

labels.description:
Specify labels for this route, which are used by other resources (e.g. TrafficPolicy) to
select specific routes within a given gateway object.

matchers.description:
Matchers contain parameters for matching requests (i.e., based on HTTP path, headers, etc.).
If empty, the route will match all requests (i.e, a single "/" path prefix matcher).
For delegated routes, any parent matcher must have a `prefix` path matcher.

headers.description: Specify a set of headers which requests must match in entirety (all headers must match).

invertMatch.description:
If set to true, the result of the match will be inverted. Defaults to false.

   Examples:

       - name=foo, invert_match=true: matches if no header named `foo` is present
       - name=foo, value=bar, invert_match=true: matches if no header named `foo` with value `bar` is present
       - name=foo, value=``\d{3}``, regex=true, invert_match=true: matches if no header named `foo` with a value consisting of three integers is present.

name.description: Specify the name of the header in the request.

regex.description: Specify whether the header value should be treated as regex.

value.description:
Specify the value of the header. If the value is absent a request that
has the name header will match, regardless of the header’s value.

method.description: Specify an HTTP method to match against.

name.description:
The name assigned to a match. The match's name will be
concatenated with the parent route's name and will be logged in
the access logs for requests matching this route.

queryParameters.description: Specify a set of URL query parameters which requests must match in entirety (all query params must match).

name.description: Specify the name of a key that must be present in the requested path's query string.

regex.description: If true, treat `value` as a regular expression.

value.description: Specify the value of the query parameter keyed on `name`.

uri.description: Specify match criteria against the targeted path.

ignoreCase.description: If true, indicates the exact/prefix/suffix matching should be case insensitive. This has no effect for the regex match.

name.description:
The name provides a convenience for users to be able to refer to a route by name.
It includes names of VS, Route, and RouteTable ancestors of the Route.

options.description:
Route Options extend the behavior of routes.
Route options include configuration such as retries, rate limiting, and request/response transformation.
RouteOption behavior will be inherited by delegated routes which do not specify their own `options`

corsPolicy.description:
Set a Cross-Origin Resource Sharing policy (CORS) for requests. Refer to [this link](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Access_control_CORS)
for further details about cross origin resource sharing.

allowCredentials.description:
Indicates whether the caller is allowed to send the actual request
(not the preflight) using credentials. Translates to the
`Access-Control-Allow-Credentials` header.

allowHeaders.description:
List of HTTP headers that can be used when requesting the
resource. Serialized to the `Access-Control-Allow-Headers` header.

allowMethods.description:
List of HTTP methods allowed to access the resource. The content will
be serialized to the `Access-Control-Allow-Methods` header.

allowOrigins.description: String patterns that match allowed origins. An origin is allowed if any of the string matchers match.

ignoreCase.description: If true, indicates the exact/prefix/suffix matching should be case insensitive. This has no effect for the regex match.

exposeHeaders.description:
A list of HTTP headers that browsers are allowed to
access. Serialized to the `Access-Control-Expose-Headers` header.

maxAge.description:
Specify how long the results of a preflight request can be
cached. Serialized to the `Access-Control-Max-Age` header.

csrf.description: Configure the Envoy based CSRF filter

additionalOrigins.description:
Specifies additional source origins that will be allowed in addition to
the destination origin.

ignoreCase.description: If true, indicates the exact/prefix/suffix matching should be case insensitive. This has no effect for the regex match.

filterEnabled.description: Specifies that CSRF policies will be evaluated, tracked and enforced.

percentage.description:
Specifies the % of requests for which the CSRF filter is enabled or when shadow mode is enabled the % of requests
evaluated and tracked, but not enforced.

If filter_enabled or shadow_enabled is true.
Envoy will lookup the runtime key to get the percentage of requests to filter.

.. note:: This field defaults to 100

shadowEnabled.description:
Specifies that CSRF policies will be evaluated and tracked, but not enforced.

This is intended to be used when ``filter_enabled`` is false and will be ignored otherwise.

abort.description: Abort the request and return the specified error code back to traffic source.

httpStatus.description: Required. HTTP status code to use to abort the request.

fixedDelay.description: Add a delay of a fixed duration before sending the request. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. MUST be >=1ms.

percentage.description: Percentage of requests to be faulted. Values range between 0 and 100. If omitted all requests will be faulted.

appendRequestHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before forwarding a request to the destination service.

appendResponseHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before returning a response to the caller.

removeRequestHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before forwarding a request to the destination service.

removeResponseHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before returning a response to the caller.

mirror.description: Mirror traffic to a another destination (traffic will be sent to its original destination in addition to the mirrored destinations).

kubeService.description: Reference (name, namespace, Gloo Mesh cluster) to a Kubernetes service.

clusterName.description: name of the cluster in which the resource exists

name.description: name of the resource being referenced

namespace.description: namespace of the resource being referenced

percentage.description: Percentage of traffic to mirror. If omitted all traffic will be mirrored. Values must be between 0 and 100.

port.description: Port on the destination to receive traffic. Required if the destination exposes multiple ports.

mtls.description: Configure mTLS settings. If specified will override global default defined in Settings.

outlierDetection.description:
Configure [outlier detection](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/intro/arch_overview/upstream/outlier) on the selected destinations.
Specifying this field requires an empty `source_selector` because it must apply to all traffic.

baseEjectionTime.description: The minimum ejection duration. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. Must be >= `1ms`. A default will be used if not set.

consecutiveErrors.description: The number of errors before a host is ejected from the connection pool. A default will be used if not set.

interval.description: The time interval between ejection sweep analysis. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. Must be >= `1ms`. A default will be used if not set.

maxEjectionPercent.description:
The maximum percentage of hosts that can be ejected from the load balancing pool.
At least one host will be ejected regardless of the value. Must be between 0 and 100. A default will be used if not set.

rateLimit.description: Config the Envoy based Ratelimit filter

advanced.description:
Partial config for GlooE rate-limiting based on Envoy's rate-limit service;
supports Envoy's rate-limit service API. (reference here: https://github.com/lyft/ratelimit#configuration)
Configure rate-limit *actions* here, which define how request characteristics get translated into
descriptors used by the rate-limit service for rate-limiting. Configure rate-limit *descriptors* and
their associated limits on the Gloo settings.
Only one of `ratelimit` or `rate_limit_configs` can be set.

descriptorValue.description: The value to use in the descriptor entry.

headerValueMatch.description: Rate limit on the existence of request headers.

descriptorValue.description: The value to use in the descriptor entry.

point numbers or if only a subsequence of the header value is an integer.

Examples:

* For range [-10,0), route will match for header value -1, but not for 0, "somestring", 10.9,
  "-1somestring"

regexMatch.description:
If specified, this regex string is a regular expression rule which implies the entire request
header value must match the regex. The rule will not match if only a subsequence of the
request header value matches the regex. The regex grammar used in the value field is defined
`(here)[https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/regex/ecmascript]`.

Examples:

* The regex *\d{3}* matches the value *123*
* The regex *\d{3}* does not match the value *1234*
* The regex *\d{3}* does not match the value *123.456*

suffixMatch.description:
If specified, header match will be performed based on the suffix of the header value.
Note: empty suffix is not allowed, please use present_match instead.

Examples:

* The suffix *abcd* matches the value *xyzabcd*, but not for *xyzbcd*.

descriptorKey.description: The key to use in the descriptor entry.

headerName.description:
The header name to be queried from the request headers. The header’s
value is used to populate the value of the descriptor entry for the
descriptor_key.

basic.description: Config for rate-limiting using simplified (gloo-specific) API

configRefs.description:
References to RateLimitConfig resources. This is used to configure the GlooE rate limit server.
Only one of `ratelimit` or `rate_limit_configs` can be set.

name.description: name of the resource being referenced

namespace.description: namespace of the resource being referenced

retries.description: Set a retry policy on requests.

attempts.description: Number of retries for a given request

perTryTimeout.description: Timeout per retry attempt for a given request. Format: `1h`/`1m`/`1s`/`1ms`. *Must be >= 1ms*.

trafficShift.description: Shift traffic to a different destination.

clusterHeader.description:
Envoy will determine the cluster to route to by reading the value of the HTTP header named by cluster_header from the request headers.
If the header is not found or the referenced cluster does not exist, Envoy will return a 404 response.
Avoid using this whenever possible, it does not allow for custom filter configuration based on Virtual Host.
{{/* NOTE: unimplemented */}}

clusterName.description: The Gloo Mesh cluster name (registration name) of the service.

port.description: Port on the service to receive traffic. Required if the service exposes more than one port.

subset.description: Specify, by labels, a subset of service instances to route to.

options.description:
additional options / config for a route which will be applied
when this destination is selected.

headerManipulation.description: manipualte headers on traffic sent to this destination

appendRequestHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before forwarding a request to the destination service.

appendResponseHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to add before returning a response to the caller.

removeRequestHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before forwarding a request to the destination service.

removeResponseHeaders.description: HTTP headers to remove before returning a response to the caller.

staticDestination.description: Reference to a gloo mesh Static Destination

name.description: name of the resource being referenced

namespace.description: namespace of the resource being referenced

name.description: The name of the VirtualDestination object.

namespace.description: The namespace of the VirtualDestination object.

subset.description: Specify, by labels, a subset of service instances backing the VirtualDestination to route to.

weight.description:
Specify the proportion of traffic to be forwarded to this destination.
Weights across all of the `destinations` must sum to 100.

redirectAction.description: Redirect actions tell the proxy to return a redirect response to the downstream client.

hostRedirect.description: The host portion of the URL will be swapped with this value.

httpsRedirect.description: The scheme portion of the URL will be swapped with "https".

pathRedirect.description: The path portion of the URL will be swapped with this value.

prefixRewrite.description:
Indicates that during redirection, the matched prefix (or path)
should be swapped with this value. This option allows redirect URLs be dynamically created
based on the request.

  Pay attention to the use of trailing slashes as mentioned in
  `RouteAction`'s `prefix_rewrite`.

responseCode.description:
The HTTP status code to use in the redirect response. The default response
code is MOVED_PERMANENTLY (301).

stripQuery.description:
Indicates that during redirection, the query portion of the URL will
be removed. Default value is false.

routeAction.description:
This action is the primary action to be selected for most routes. The RouteAction tells the proxy to
route requests to an upstream.

destinations.description: Defines the destination upstream for routi
